servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

ptxt.emph: P2100: Throttle Actuator Control Motor Circuit / Open

entry.ptxt: Throttle actuator control circuit malfunction (open circuit, short to power supply circuit or short to ground) is detected.

ptxt.emph: P2101: Throttle Actuator Control Motor Circuit Range / Performance

entry.ptxt: This DTC is detected if any one of the following conditions is met.

item.ptxt: Duty ratio of throttle actuator control signal is higher than specified valve for specified time.
Difference between targeted TP and measured TP is out of specified range.

attention3.ptxt: Make sure that the following conditions are satisfied when using this procedure.

s1.ptxt: Depress accelerator pedal fully, and release it.

testgroup.question: Was “Engine and Emission Control System Check” performed?

action.ptxt: Go to Engine and Emission Control System Check:N32A .

test1.ptxt: With ignition switch turned OFF, disconnect connectors from throttle body and ECM.
Check for proper terminal connection to throttle body and ECM connectors.
If connections are OK, check that throttle actuator control circuit (B1 and B2) is as follows.

item.ptxt: Wiring harness resistance of each throttle actuator control circuit is less than 3 Ω.
Insulation resistance of each throttle actuator control circuit are infinity between throttle body connector and vehicle body ground.
Insulation resistance of wire harness is infinity between each throttle actuator control circuit terminals and other terminal at throttle body connector.
Circuit voltage of each throttle actuator control circuit are 0 – 1 V with ignition switch turned ON.

action.ptxt: Repair or replace defective wire harness.

testgroup.title: Troubleshooting of other DTC(s) detected at the same time
testgroup.question: Is other DTC(s) detected together?

action.ptxt: Go to troubleshooting for applicable DTC.
Substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
